title: What Size Of Pigs Should I Start My Farm With?

tasks.task: Discussing pig farm size options for new farmers
subtasks: Introduce the four sizes of pigs discussed (pregnant, growers, winners, mature non-pregnant)
Compare the costs of each pig size (pregnant pig costs ~400,000, growers ~80,000-120,000, winners ~50,000-100,000)
Evaluate risk factors associated with each pig size (high risk with pregnant pigs, lower risk with grower and winner pigs)
Discuss the challenges of raising pregnant pigs (transport issues, potential for abortions, unpredictable piglet survival)
Highlight the benefits of starting with grower or winner pigs (mitigated risk, hands-on experience, ability to learn from individual failures)
Emphasize the importance of experience in pig farming and the value of trial and error with younger pigs
Encourage new farmers to consider multiple factors (cost, risk, experience) when choosing their starting pig size
